title: Wood typeface with texture
content:
Does anyone know of a font based on wood letters that actually shows the grain texture of wood? (I guess scanned images would be OK too).

 [‹ 2 easy ones: seriff and sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905134617/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41348 "Go to previous forum topic") [logo book font id ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905134617/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41318 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Baruch Gorkin

comments.content:
I can recommend this one: [http://www.withoutwalls.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905134617/http:/www.withoutwalls.com/)  
I just got a copy of the DVD and it looks great.
Ask a letterpress printer to set an alphabet for you to then scan in. Quick, not too expensive, and custom!
